nodes.text: We are committed to free and open competition in our markets. We compete fairly and ethically and support laws that promote and protect competition.

We never discuss or agree to allocate or divide up markets, customers or territories for all or part of a contract with our competitors. Doing so is a criminal offence and can result in heavy penalties and prosecution.
Report any suspicion or evidence of this behaviour immediately to your legal team.
Do not discuss the allocation of markets or any other competitively sensitive information any further.  Immediately leave the meeting or the event if you hear it happening and report it.

Paying a small sum of money to an official to speed up a process is known as a facilitation payment. We make no distinction between facilitation payments and bribes, no matter how small the amount. Facilitation payments are illegal in most countries in which we operate and UK law forbids them anywhere in the world.
It is unlikely to be a facilitation payment if it is an official, fixed and published fee and you will get a receipt.

However, there are legitimate fees for speeding up some services such as a fee to quickly process an application. Make the payment if it is an official transaction and it has been asked for in an open and transparent way.
Obtain a receipt detailing the reason for and the amount of the charge.
Record the transaction appropriately.
If you are in any doubt do not pay.

188565.title: Remain calm and be prepared to wait.  Showing impatience can increase pressure to pay.  Use any or all of these statements to help you explain why you won't pay.

Report it
